hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Regime Transition via 30-Day Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence > 60%) with 30-day realized volatility below 40% and price consolidates within ±5% of its 20-day moving average for at least 10 days, a breakout above the consolidation range's upper bound on >1.5x average volume signals a transition to BULL regime, with the move sustaining for 3+ days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended low-volatility consolidation in neutral regimes often precedes directional regime shifts. Volume-confirmed breakouts from tight ranges have historically signaled sustainable trend initiations, as suppressed volatility releases pent-up directional pressure.
entry_conditions: BTC price within ±5% of 20-day SMA for ≥10 consecutive days
BTC closes > upper bound of consolidation range (20-day SMA +5%)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches +15% from entry, or regime shifts to BULL (confidence > 70%) and holds for 3 days
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes below consolidation range lower bound (20-day SMA -5%)
exit_conditions.time_exit: 7 days with no regime transition confirmation

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to hold for 3 days with >60% BULL regime confidence, or price immediately reverts to consolidation range without volume follow-through.
